name: Give Me A Letter ... Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What D is an independent island nation in the Caribbean Sea, whose capital and chief port is Roseau?
questions.explanation:
Dominica.

	Dominica is the largest of the Windward Islands. It was named after 'dies dominica' (Latin for 'Sunday'), the day it was discovered by Christopher Columbus(1493).

questions.text: What D is a river in Spain and Portugal, that empties into the Atlantic Ocean at Oporto?
questions.explanation:
Douro.

	Rising in north-central Spain, the Douro flows west to form part of the Spanish Portuguese border. Along its banks are grown the grapes that make port wine.

questions.text: What L is a representative assembly whose primary function is the enactment of laws?
questions.explanation:
Legislature.

	Legislatures can be either unicameral or bicameral.

questions.text: What L is a feature of organisms that sets them apart from inorganic matter?
questions.explanation:
life & living & live.

	Life can be regarded as the ability to obtain energy from the sun or from food and to use this for growth and reproduction.

questions.text: What A is the study of the influence supposedly exerted by stars and planets on the natures and lives of human beings?
questions.explanation:
Astrology.

	Western astrology draws specifically on the movements of the Sun, Moon, and major planets of the Solar System in relation to the stars that make up the 12 constellations known as the Zodiac.

questions.text: What A was the last Inca ruler of Peru?
questions.explanation:
Atahualpa.

	Atahualpa was the son of Huayna Capac, upon his father's death he inherited Quito. In November 1532 he was captured by Francisco Pizarro and later executed.

questions.text: What P is the head of a family or tribe, invested in certain circumstances with the status or authority of a religious leader?
questions.explanation:
Patriarch.

	Since about the 4th century AD, the word has also been used as an ecclesiastic title for a few exalted Eastern Christian bishops, who rule over large dioceses known as patriarchates.

questions.text: What S is a mostly terrestrial gastropod Mollusk, identified by the lack of shell and uncoiled viscera?
questions.explanation:
Slug.

	Slugs secrete a protective slime, which is also used to aid locomotion.

questions.text: What L is the distance North or South of the Equator?
questions.explanation:
Latitude.

	Degrees of latitude are measured at an angle from the Earth's center.

questions.text: What E is the largest living Antelope?
questions.explanation:
Eland.

	Elands are native to central and southern Africa.
